intro: Malvastrum waltheriifolium, commonly known as the silverleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which gives it its common name, and its showy, pale pink to lavender flowers. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is known for its hairy stems and lobed leaves. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and along dry streambeds. Malvastrum waltheriifolium is a perennial shrub that blooms from spring to summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
